XenotypeDef.label: Spirit-Bound Lich
XenotypeDef.description: Spirit-Bound Liches are created by binding the soul to a dead body in a manner similar, but exclusive to, resurrection magic. Spirit-Bound Liches must always thus be created. The soul effectively "haunts" the body, in a fashion not unlike how haunted structures function, granting the Spirit-Bound Lich significantly greater abilities than a merely animated skeleton.
XenotypeDef.descriptionShort: A self-willed skeleton created by necromantic magic.

XenotypeDef.label: Kalanothi Elf
XenotypeDef.description: An specific type of elf, named for the elves from the Aotrs planet Kalanoth where the definition was codified. Due to the prevalence of Harbinger Retrocasual Probability Engineering, this type of elf is quite common in the galaxy and possibly beyond, even when arising from apparently otherwise entirely unrelated worlds. Kalanothi elves are closely releated to fey, granting them functional immunity to nonmagical diseases, senses keener than humans and generally fair forms. This type of elf does not naturally age and are functionally immortal is not killed by combat or misfortune.

XenotypeDef.label: Kalanothi Orc
XenotypeDef.description: An specific type of orc, named for the elves from the Aotrs planet Kalanoth where the definition was codified. Due to the prevalence of Harbinger Retrocasual Probability Engineering, this type of orc is quite common in the galaxy and possibly beyond, even when arising from apparently otherwise entirely unrelated worlds. Kalanothi orcs are bulkier than humans and more aggressive, but not as brutish as some orc strains.

XenotypeDef.label: Animated Skeleton
XenotypeDef.description: Skeletons created by Animate Dead spells are little more than negative energy-powered constructs.
XenotypeDef.descriptionShort: A mindless skeleton created by necromantic magic.
